definition: affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means
(political, economic etc) affairs/work/transaction (as in a computer database)

sentences.english: From business reception to dispatching requisition, again to inspection settlement.
sentences.chinese: 從業務接待到派工領料，再到檢驗結算。

sentences.english: Friend, transaction is cut straight to rise to good also.
sentences.chinese: 朋友之義，務在切直以升於善道者也。

sentences.english: If your watch has a screw-lock type crown , be sure to tighten the crown completely .
sentences.chinese: 如果腕錶有螺絲鎖錶冠，務必將錶冠完全擰緊。

sentences.english: He job-hopped to establish Zhonghua Book Company on the New Years Day of 1912.
sentences.chinese: 1912年元旦，他從商務“跳槽”而創辦中華書局。

sentences.english: You may rent a laptop and LCD from the Business Center.
sentences.chinese: 您可以從商務中間租一臺筆記本電腦和液晶投影儀。

sentences.english: It discussed some of the business and usability reasons for doing so.
sentences.chinese: 該部分從業務和可用性方面討論了這樣做的必要性。

sentences.english: If you have an herb garden, be sure to include peppermint .
sentences.chinese: 如果你有一種藥草園，務必將薄荷。

sentences.english: She spots an interesting quote from a columnist in the business section.
sentences.chinese: 她從業務版面點了一個專欄作家的有趣的引用。

sentences.english: For the normal operation of enterprises serve to create a leak-free enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 爲企業正常運轉服好務，創造無泄漏企業。

sentences.english: However, services still operate independently of each other.
sentences.chinese: 然而，菔務仍然獨立於彼此運垳。

definition: line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to implement/to carry out/to execute/to run
to set up/to arrange/to establish/to found/to display
for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
